text:
February 14, 1958
Or. Kenneth Harwood, Chairman
Department of Telecomaunicatioos
University of Southern California
Los Angeles, California
Dear Ken:
Thank you very much for your letter and report. You
did an excellent job and 1 think that the recommendation is
a good one.
1 assume that Harry will inform the recipients of
the grants of the fact that they are recipients and it seems
to me perfectly in order that he urge Koger to take extreme
care in identifying opinion leaders and to consider care¬
fully the possibility of obtaining his information through
personal interviews. (Harry, these suggestions were noted
by Ken, ifamata, and Merrill and I certainly concur. If
followed, these would strengthen his study tremendously and
it seems to me clearly proper for the KAEB to make these sug¬
gestions.)
By the way, Ken, John Parsey has informed me that you
might be doing the inventory-digest of radio research. I hope
you do. I assume that he will pass on the few comments that
X had. The major me was that X would hope that you would do
an evaluation as well as a summary and place some emphasis
on methodology as well as findings. (I am sure that you had
these things in mind anyway.)
Thank you again for your letter and your good work on
the grante-in-aid project.
Sincerely,
Sam L. Becker
Director, Division of
Television-Radio-Film
SLB;mw
cc: Dr. Barry Skornia
